jparsec.util

Class Logger

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.util.Logger

  • public class Logger
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides basic logging capabilities. Each log is optionally written to a log file with a path defined by a static constant configFile. The maximum size in MB can also be configured (before writting the first log entry). The log is initialized automatically in the first call to write a log entry. The log entry has a very simple format with the date (format yyyy-MMM-dd HH:mm:ss), the process identifier (typically process id number@host), the method including the class where the entry is originated, and the message.
    Since:
    1.85
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain).

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Logger.LEVEL
      The basic levels of a given log message.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String configFile
      Holds the local path of the log file, default is null to avoid writing to a file.
      static int configFileMaxSizeMB
      Holds the maximum size of the log file in MB, default is 20.
      static boolean reportJPARSECLogs
      Set to false (default is true) to avoid reporting internal log messages from JPARSEC library.

    • Method Summary

      Disables the output of the logging to the file.

      Writes a message to the log.
      static boolean removeLogFile()
      Removes the log file.

      Sets the logging level of the file handler.

    • Field Detail

      • configFile

        public static java.lang.String configFile
        Holds the local path of the log file, default is null to avoid writing to a file.

      • configFileMaxSizeMB

        public static int configFileMaxSizeMB
        Holds the maximum size of the log file in MB, default is 20.

      • reportJPARSECLogs

        public static boolean reportJPARSECLogs
        Set to false (default is true) to avoid reporting internal log messages from JPARSEC library.

    • Method Detail

      • enableLogging

        public static void enableLogging()
        Enables the logging system. Logging is enabled by default.

      • disableLogging

        public static void disableLogging()
        Disables the logging system.

      • log

        public static void log(Logger.LEVEL level,
       java.lang.String message)
        Writes a message to the log. In case the logger is not started, it is automatically done.
        Parameters:
        level - The level of the message.
        message - The message.

      • log

        public static void log(Logger.LEVEL level,
       java.lang.String message,
       java.lang.String lastMethod)
        Writes a message to the log. In case the logger is not started, it is automatically done.
        Parameters:
        level - The level of the message.
        message - The message.
        lastMethod - The name of the method that originates the log message.

      • setLoggerLevel

        public static void setLoggerLevel(Logger.LEVEL level)
        Sets the logging level of the global logger. The default value is the information level.
        Parameters:
        level - The minimum level to report logs. Null will turn off the logger.

      • setFileHandlerLevel

        public static void setFileHandlerLevel(Logger.LEVEL level)
                                throws java.lang.SecurityException,
                                       java.io.IOException
        Sets the logging level of the file handler. The default value at startup will write all messages to the file.
        Parameters:
        level - The minimum level to report logs to the file. Null will turn off the logger.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the logger cannot be initialized.
        java.lang.SecurityException - If the logger cannot be initialized.

      • disableWritingToFile

        public static void disableWritingToFile()
        Disables the output of the logging to the file.

      • enableWritingToFile

        public static void enableWritingToFile()
                                throws java.lang.Exception
        Enables the output of the logging to the file.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If the file handler must be created and this process fails.

      • removeLogFile

        public static boolean removeLogFile()
        Removes the log file.
        Returns:
        True if it is deleted successfully.

      • getLogFileContents

        public static java.lang.String[] getLogFileContents()
                                             throws JPARSECException
        Returns the contents of the log file.
        Returns:
        The contents, or null if it is not found.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs reading the log file.
